http://id.loc.gov/ontologies/bflc/aap.@value: Baldwin, James, 1924-1987 The fire next time

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: United States, Library of Congress, Network Development and MARC Standards Office
My dungeon shook: letter to my nephew on the one hundredth anniversary of the Emancipation -- Down at the cross: letter from a region in my mind

At once a powerful evocation of his childhood in Harlem and a disturbing examination of the consequences of racial injustice, The Fire Next Time, which galvanized the nation in the early days of the Civil Rights movement, stands as one of the essential works of our literature
